channel.title: Comments on: The Battle Over Net Neutrality
channel.description: Tech news worth talking about and tech help worth listening to

item.title: By: Netflix is King | Deemable
item.dc:creator: Netflix is King | Deemable
item.description: [...] The growth of Netflix and similar online alternatives certainly benefit the consumer, with monthly subscriptions costing only $7.99 for Netflix’s all-you-can-watch, streaming-only service. Traditional TV networks, however, are not too pleased with the online competition threatening their business model. Also, the enormous amount of bandwidth that Netflix takes up decreases internet speeds for other users, which is one of the main arguments against Network Neutrality. [...]
item.content:encoded: […] The growth of Netflix and similar online alternatives certainly benefit the consumer, with monthly subscriptions costing only $7.99 for Netflix’s all-you-can-watch, streaming-only service. Traditional TV networks, however, are not too pleased with the online competition threatening their business model. Also, the enormous amount of bandwidth that Netflix takes up decreases internet speeds for other users, which is one of the main arguments against Network Neutrality. […]

item.title: By: David Ahn
item.dc:creator: David Ahn
item.description: Thanks for the support! I doubt that the Joint Resolution will pass through the Senate, but if it does then President Obama has assured that he will veto it, which would then require 2/3 vote of both houses of Congress to override his veto.
item.content:encoded: Thanks for the support! I doubt that the Joint Resolution will pass through the Senate, but if it does then President Obama has assured that he will veto it, which would then require 2/3 vote of both houses of Congress to override his veto.

item.title: By: Chris Johnson
item.dc:creator: Chris Johnson
item.description: Great piece. Thank God Obama supports an open internet.
item.content:encoded: Great piece. Thank God Obama supports an open internet.
